chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
ff: falsity_flag
R: BSRS
rho: env (string bool)

Goal:
rho ⊫ F2

Premises:
env = fun domain : Type => nat -> domain : Type -> Type Arguments env _%type_scope
string = fun X : Type => list X : Type -> Type Arguments string _%type_scope
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
IB_F1 : forall rho : env (string bool), rho ⊫ F1
bounded_subst : bounded ?n ?phi -> (forall k : nat, ?n > k -> ?sigma k = ?tau k) -> ?phi[?sigma] = ?phi[?tau] where ?n : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- nat] ?phi : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- form] ?sigma : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- nat -> term] ?tau : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- nat -> term]
VectorDef.map : (?A -> ?B) -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n where ?A : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- Type] ?B : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- Type]
enumerator__T_prod : forall (f1 : nat -> option ?X) (f2 : nat -> option ?Y), enumerator__T f1 ?X -> enumerator__T f2 ?Y -> enumerator__T (prod_enum f1 f2) (?X * ?Y) where ?X : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- Type] ?Y : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- Type]
Ctx : forall (A : list form) (phi : form), In phi A -> A ⊢ phi where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
Exp : forall (A : list form) (phi : form), A ⊢ falsity -> A ⊢ phi where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
ListEnumerabilityFacts.enumerator__T_list : forall L : nat -> list ?X, ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' ?X L -> ListEnumerabilityFacts.list_enumerator__T' (list ?X) (ListEnumerabilityFacts.L_list L) where ?X : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- Type]
AllI : forall (A : list form) (phi : form), map (subst_form ↑) A ⊢ phi -> A ⊢ (∀ phi) where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
AllE : forall (A : list form) (t : term) (phi : form), A ⊢ (∀ phi) -> A ⊢ phi[t..] where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
II : forall (A : list form) (phi psi : form), (phi :: A) ⊢ psi -> A ⊢ (phi --> psi) where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
der_sing : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X), In (x / y) P -> derivable P x y where ?X : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- Type]
Weak : forall (A B : list form) (phi : form), A ⊢ phi -> incl A B -> B ⊢ phi where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
impl_prv : forall (A B : list form) (phi : form), (rev B ++ A) ⊢ phi -> A ⊢ (B ==> phi) where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
IE : forall (A : list form) (phi psi : form), A ⊢ (phi --> psi) -> A ⊢ phi -> A ⊢ psi where ?p : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- peirce]
impl_sat' : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (ff : falsity_flag) (A : list form) (rho : env D) (phi : form), rho ⊨ (A ==> phi) -> rho ⊫ A -> rho ⊨ phi
impl_sat : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (ff : falsity_flag) (A : list form) (rho : env D) (phi : form), rho ⊨ (A ==> phi) < -> (rho ⊫ A -> rho ⊨ phi)
der_cons : forall (P : stack ?X) (x y : list ?X) (u v : string ?X), In (x / y) P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) where ?X : [ff : falsity_flag R : BSRS rho : env (string bool) |- Type]
IB_drv : forall (rho : env (string bool)) (t1 t2 : term), rho ⊨ Pr t1 t2 < -> derivable R (eval rho t1) (eval rho t2)
IB_enc : forall (rho : env (string bool)) (s : string bool), eval rho (enc s) = s
valid_ctx = fun (Σ_funcs : funcs_signature) (Σ_preds : preds_signature) (ff : falsity_flag) (A : list form) (phi : form) => forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (rho : env D), rho ⊫ A -> rho ⊨ phi : forall (Σ_funcs : funcs_signature) (Σ_preds : preds_signature) (ff : falsity_flag), list form -> form -> Prop Arguments valid_ctx {Σ_funcs Σ_preds ff} _%list_scope
fullsatis = fun (Σ_funcs : funcs_signature) (Σ_preds : preds_signature) (ff : falsity_flag) (A : list form) => exists (D : Type) (I : interp D) (rho : env D), rho ⊫ A : forall (Σ_funcs : funcs_signature) (Σ_preds : preds_signature) (ff : falsity_flag), list form -> Prop Arguments fullsatis {Σ_funcs Σ_preds ff} _%list_scope
valid_L = fun (Σ_funcs : funcs_signature) (Σ_preds : preds_signature) (ff : falsity_flag) (A : list form) => forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (rho : env D), rho ⊫ A : forall (Σ_funcs : funcs_signature) (Σ_preds : preds_signature) (ff : falsity_flag), list form -> Prop Arguments valid_L {Σ_funcs Σ_preds ff} _%list_scope
Kripke.kripke_tarski : forall (domain : Type) (I : interp domain) (rho : env domain) (phi : form), rho ⊨ phi < -> Kripke.ksat tt rho phi
IB_prep : forall (rho : env (list bool)) (s : string bool) (t : term), eval rho (prep s t) = s ++ eval rho t
sat_subst : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (ff : falsity_flag) (rho : env D) (sigma : nat -> term) (phi : form), (forall x : nat, eval rho (sigma x) = rho x) -> rho ⊨ phi < -> rho ⊨ phi[sigma]
iprep_eval : forall (domain : Type) (I : interp domain) (rho : env domain) (x : string bool) (s : term), eval rho (prep x s) = iprep x (eval rho s)
Inductive falsity_flag : Set := falsity_off : falsity_flag | falsity_on : falsity_flag
eval_comp : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (rho : env D) (xi : nat -> term) (t : term), eval rho t`[xi] = eval (xi >> eval rho) t
IB = B_I (fun f : sig_func => match f as s return (Vector.t (string bool) (ar_syms s) -> string bool) with | s_f b => fun v : Vector.t (string bool) (ar_syms (s_f b)) => b :: Vector.hd v | s_e => fun _ : Vector.t (string bool) (ar_syms s_e) => [] end) (fun P : sig_pred => match P as s return (Vector.t (string bool) (ar_preds s) -> Prop) with | sPr => fun v : Vector.t (string bool) (ar_preds sPr) => derivable R (Vector.hd v) (Vector.hd (Vector.tl v)) | sQ => fun _ : Vector.t (string bool) (ar_preds sQ) => dPCPb R end) : interp (string bool)
sat_comp : forall (D : Type) (I : interp D) (ff : falsity_flag) (rho : env D) (xi : nat -> term) (phi : form), rho ⊨ phi[xi] < -> (xi >> eval rho) ⊨ phi
